intro: Maurandya lophospermum, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 30 to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in terminal racemes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and containers.
